metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7529 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Nginx versions since 0.5.6 up to and including 1.13.2 are vulnerable tointeger overflow vulnerability in nginx range filter module resulting intoleak of potentially sensitive information triggered by specially craftedrequest.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7529` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nginx - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
nginx-common - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
nginx-core - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
nginx-extras - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
nginx-full - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
nginx-light - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nginx package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
